caption:
“We see far because we stand on the shoulders of giants.” 🏔️

This International Women’s Day, we celebrate the true OG whose spirit vibrates throughout Omsom - our Bà Nội (or paternal grandma) 🙏🏽

The quintessential Vietnamese matriarch, Bích-Anh single-handedly raised 6 children in Saigon with only a third-grade education. In her day, Vietnamese women didn’t have much opportunity / economic mobility, especially if not born into affluent families. Ông Nội, or our grandfather, was a general in the Vietnam War, so she was left to take care of the family during some truly harrowing war times.

Bà Nội is the strongest woman we know — and while we have a tricky relationship with this narrative of the relentlessly “strong Vietnamese woman,” we continue to be inspired by her discipline + dedication. Bà Nội is the reason we (and Omsom) exist in the world today 🧡

Some fun facts about Bà Nội:
☸️ She now lives in southern California, where she remains committed to her Buddhist faith + regularly donates to her local temples.
🪡 She is a really talented sewist (which @kimoftheinternet takes after).
💭 Papa Pham considers her to be very progressive, because of how hands off she was with raising us 😋

Hope y’all are able to take stock today of whose shoulders you stand on 🙏🏽 We love you, Bà Nội!
